result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Fernando Davis Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees. Out of bail on deposit, if any; or up to 25% of prison funds. Balance prior to the end of Extended Supervision on case 06CF004093. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 06CF004093.  Straight time.

Provide a biological specimen DNA to the State Crime lab for testing.
Defendant must comply with the Sex offender registry.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Fernando Davis Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 4 MONTHS, STRAIGHT TIME,  in the House of Correction, to run concurrent to case 06CF004093 with credit for 22 days time served.  

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, IF ANY, or up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision on case 06CF004093.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  Defendant must comply with the Sex Offender Registry.

Received and filed with court:
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, Defendant Jerry Fernando Davis not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Jerry Fernando Davis not in court, in custody.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
PER JUDGE MCADAMS THIS CASE CAN BE ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with the court.

Defendant Jerry Fernando Davis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Jerry Fernando Davis in custody.  James Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.   Arraignment scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jerry Fernando Davis in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Jerry Fernando Davis in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Due to scheduling Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jerry Fernando Davis Jr
Current: 100 Kilps Ct East, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 11-19-2015)
Prior: 5009 N. 46th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
